    • Method Detail

      • moveValidation

        public boolean moveValidation(int colNum,
                              java.lang.String player)
        This method checks the validity of column if invalid column is selected, and then a new column is tried.
        Parameters:
        colNum - is the column number the player is attempting to place a piece at.
        player - determines the player as being either a playerX, playerO, or computer
        Returns:
        Returns true if the player has selected a column in the bounds of the board, returns false if the player has selected a column outside of the board bounds.

      • gamePlacement

        public void gamePlacement(int columNumber,
                          java.lang.String user)
        This method places respective game pieces on the board. It will also check whether or not the attempted column is full or not. If it is full this method will recursively call to check validity of new user input.
        Parameters:
        columNumber - is the column that the user's piece is being placed.
        user - is user who has the turn.

      • checkForPlayerWinner

        public void checkForPlayerWinner(java.lang.String player)
        This method checks the player winner
        Parameters:
        player - whose turn it it to play the game
        Throws:
        java.util.InputMismatchException - if inputs are mismatched

      • boardOutput

        public java.lang.String boardOutput()
        Checks the contents of the display and validates it
        Returns:
        contents

      • horizontalWinCheck

        public boolean horizontalWinCheck(java.lang.String player)
        This method checks for game placement in the horizontal direction.
        Parameters:
        player - is the player who has the turn.
        Returns:
        This method will return true if the current player has played four game pieces consecutively in the horizontal direction, and false otherwise (no current win).

      • verticalWinCheck

        public boolean verticalWinCheck(java.lang.String player)
        This method checks for consecutive game piece placement in the vertical direction.
        Parameters:
        player - is the respective player who has the current turn.
        Returns:
        This method will return true if the current player has placed four consecutive game pieces in the vertical direction, and false otherwise (no current win).

      • diagonalAscendingWinCheck

        public boolean diagonalAscendingWinCheck(java.lang.String player)
        This method checks for game placement for ascending diagonal by comparing the current board space with the next three spaces to the right and above.
        Parameters:
        player - is the respective player who has the current turn.
        Returns:
        This method will return true if the current player has placed four consecutive game pieces diagonally in an ascending direction, and false otherwise if no win.

      • diagonalDescendingWinCheck

        public boolean diagonalDescendingWinCheck(java.lang.String player)
        This method checks for consecutive game piece placement for descending diagonals by comparing the current board space with the previous three spaces to the left and below.
        Parameters:
        player - is the respective player who has the current turn.
        Returns:
        This method will return true if the current player has placed four consecutive game pieces diagonally in a descending direction, and false otherwise no win.

      • checkForDraw

        public boolean checkForDraw()
        method checks for draw game
        Returns:
        false is the game is a draw and true if it is a draw

      • loop

        public boolean loop()
        this method keeps looping the game until a winner is decided
        Returns:
        gamePlay

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        this method will return a string representation of the connect4 board.
